question: Kylie Masse, who won women's 100m backstroke gold at the 2017 World Aquatics Championships, is associated with which country?
explanation: Kylie Masse, a Canadian swimmer, has won gold in the womenâ€™s 100-metre backstroke with a world-record time of 58.10 seconds at the 2017 World Aquatics Championships in Budapest, Hungary. With this achievement, she became the first Canadian woman to become a world champion and first Canadian to win a title since Brent Hayden.
